Definition: In this task you are given a set of three sentences labeled sentence 1, sentence 2 and sentence 3, and a statement. You have to determine which of the sentences agrees with the statement, and return its number as output.

Positive Examples.input: Statement: Productivity measures the actual man-hours used versus those planned. Choices: 1. Productivity is not measured by hours that were planned. 2. Productivity is measured only by hours that are planned. 3. When productivity is measured by actual man-hours used people are incentivized to work harder.
Positive Examples.explanation: The given statement says that productivity measures the actual man-hours vs planned hours and choice 1 says that productivity is not measured by hours that were planned hence only choice 1 entails with the statement and this is a positive example.

Positive Examples.input: Statement: That's what I told my bosses. Choices: 1. I didn't talk to my bosses. 2. I told my bosses I wasn't coming to work. 3. I said that to my bosses.
Positive Examples.explanation: Choice 3 is ambiguous to Statement it doesn't say what the person told his bosses wile choice 2 says that The person told his bosses that he/she wasn't coming to work. Hence it entails with the statement and this is a positive example.

Negative Examples.input: Statement: Although the Museu da Baleia (Whale Museum) shows a video of a whale hunt in 1978, the owner is the epitome of a poacher turned gamekeeper. Choices: 1. The owner of the museum used to be a whale poacher. 2. He poached whales hoping to get revenge for his lost leg. 3. The owner of the museum has always loved and protected whales.
Negative Examples.explaination: Choice 1 is actually the sentence that entails the given sentence while there is no relevant information in the statement that agrees with the choice 2. Hence this is a negative example.
